meanings.definition: Past tense of lend too much money.
meanings.sent1: She overlent her friend some cash and now regrets it.
meanings.sent2: He always overlent money to his siblings, never expecting it back.
meanings.sent3: The bank teller accidentally overlent to a customer, causing a mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity overlenting to strangers left her in financial trouble.
meanings.sent5: The concept of overlenting is like giving away more than you have.

meanings.sent1: They overlent funds to the charity, hoping to make a difference.
meanings.sent2: The businessman overlent to expand his business, but it backfired.
meanings.sent3: The teacher overlent to students for a good cause, but it led to chaos.
meanings.sent4: His habit of overlenting made him popular but broke.
meanings.sent5: The idea of overlenting is to help, but it can harm if not managed well.
